meanings.definition: The power to produce a desired result or effect.
meanings.sent1: The effectivity of the new medicine was evident in how quickly it cured the patient.
meanings.sent2: The team's effectivity in completing the project ahead of schedule impressed their manager.
meanings.sent3: The effectivity of the magician's trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The effectivity of the vacuum cleaner was like a magic wand, making the room spotless in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The effectivity of the sunscreen was so high that not a single sunburn occurred.

meanings.definition: The quality of being effective or successful.
meanings.sent1: Her effectivity as a leader was evident in how well the team worked together.
meanings.sent2: The effectivity of the marketing campaign led to a significant increase in sales.
meanings.sent3: The effectivity of the comedian's jokes had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The effectivity of the alarm system was like having a vigilant guard at all times.
meanings.sent5: The effectivity of the student's study habits resulted in top grades in every subject.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is successful in producing a desired result.
meanings.sent1: The effectivity of the fertilizer was evident in the lushness of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The effectivity of the training program was reflected in the employees' improved performance.
meanings.sent3: The effectivity of the chef's recipe had customers coming back for more.
meanings.sent4: The effectivity of the umbrella was like a shield against the pouring rain.
meanings.sent5: The effectivity of the security system prevented any unauthorized access to the building.
